At the highest point P, the small ball is moving upward with a velocity v.
At the highest point P, the potential energy of the small ball is mgh, where h is the height above the initial position.
At the highest point P, the kinetic energy of the small ball is (1/2)mv^2.
The force exerted by the small ball on the light rod is denoted as F.
The force exerted by the light rod on the small ball is equal to mg.
At the highest point P, the net force acting on the small ball must be zero.
Since the net force is zero, the force exerted by the small ball on the light rod is equal to mg.
